p: Epidemiological data from Europe show varying rates of CDV seroprevalence in wildlife species, particularly in red foxes ( Vulpes vulpes) with a prevalence of 4% to 30.5% in countries such as Spain, Portugal, Italy, and Germany [ 30, 40, 41, 42]. In Central and South America, authors have reported the presence of CDV in 2% of wild felids in Costa Rica [ 43], while in Brazil CDV seroprevalence has been reported in multiple free-ranging wild carnivore species with a prevalence ranging between 10.6 to 23% [ 44, 45, 46].
